Navigation in the Traxidy Areas
Like most systems, Traxidy has a set of terms that we use regularly, many are standard and some are unique to us. Below is a list of key terms to know when working with Traxidy.

• For each Project, the sections in Traxidy, as listed on the left side Main Menu are called a Traxidy Area. The Traxidy Area Name will be clearly labelled near the top of each page, along with the Project Name.
• Traxidy shows a manageable number of records on each Area. Look to the bottom of the current list to show more or less records per page at one time.

• Traxidy is constantly tracking dates and information and letting you know what may need your attention through data visualization. Colors and charts are used throughout Traxidy to represent the status and key dates of activities including Actions, Risks, Changes and project constraints.

• Each project has an Overall Project Status Color and Elapsed Timeframe bar that shows the progress through the project timeframe as a percentage of elapsed time based on the project start date, end date and today&rsquo
• The Overall Project Status Color and Elapsed Timeframe bar is color-coded to show the current Overall Project Status with the associated color and letter, Green (G), Yellow (Y) or Red (R).
• The Area Records show the information and key details for that record. The information is shown horizontally from left to right, and organized by the Data Titles.
Quick Sort on Traxidy Area Record Titles
• Click on any Area Record Title as listed over the Records in any Traxidy Area and the list of records will be sorted by that Title information.
• Area Charts provide a color-coded quick view of the Traxidy Area key stats and data.
• Click a chart and go directly to the Traxidy Area for the details.
• Traxidy Area blue Key Action buttons provide a quick function for easy management of next steps.

If you provide any of your contacts with either the Access level - Contributor or Reviewer, when the contact signs in to Traxidy, they will begin on the Dashboard Area and the Access Type will appear here.

If you are a Full Access Member and also become a Contributor or Reviewer on another Member's Traxidy Project, you can simply toggle this area to view your Access Level information. This will be a different set of information and Dashboard than your own project Dashboard.

• Contributor: Traxidy enables you to choose to provide access to any Contact (Access Type) so they can access a limited amount of the project information in your Traxidy project allowing them to update only their (as Owners) Actions and Risks

• Reviewer: Traxidy enables you to choose to provide access to any Contact (Access Type) so they can access only the Project Information, Project Status, Constraints GYR and the High-Level Plan. They have no ability to edit information and can only see those specific status areas.

20,1,6,"Traxidy Risk Score, Line and Rank","

Traxidy Risk Score, Line and Rank
Risk Score is calculated for Each Risk
• When a new risk is recorded in the Project Risks Area, you will select the percent Probability of the risk occurring and the level of Impact the risk would have, to create the Risk Score.

• Each risk receives a Risk Score. Each risk is evaluated by you and your team by applying both a percentage Probability (that the risk will happen) and the Impact the risk would have on the project (if it was to occur). The multiplication of these two numbers is the Risk Score.
• The higher the Risk Score, the more critical it is to manage the risk.
The Cut-Off is at the Risk Rank Line (RRL)
• Risk Rank Line (RRL) helps you to set apart and track the risks that are seen as important and need to be monitored and managed.
• The RRL is set by you in Project Settings, through your selection of a risk threshold based on a specific Probability and Impact level. The RRL is the cut-off point for ranking your risks.

• Risk Rank Line (RRL) helps to identify the prioritized, ranked risks that are seen as important and need to be monitored and managed.

• Ask for an extension by letting us know your intent by emailing us at info@traxidy.com
• Close your account and take your data in a Comma Separated Value (CSV) file
• Delete your account with a quick survey
